channel.title: My first script (simple auto talker)

item.title: My first script (simple auto talker)
item.dc:creator: @TheDarkMage TheDarkMage
item.description:
@TheDarkMage wrote:

you’re still missing some things…

program New; var text:array of string; loopn:integer; procedure type; begin if loopn<7 then begin loopn:=loopn+1; end else begin loopn:=0; end; wait(randomrange(56,139)); keydown(getkeycode(inttostr(text[loopn]))); wait(randomrange(486,541)); keyup(getkeycode(inttostr(text[loopn]))); end; procedure move; begin wait(randomrange(161,397)); movemousespline(random(766),random(504),46,57); end; begin setarraylength(text,-1); text[1]:='add'; text[2]:='as'; text[3]:='many'; text[4]:='as'; text[5]:='you'; text[6]:='wish'; repeat type; move; until(iskeydown('1') and iskeydown('2'));//don't do this
end.

Read full topic

item.title: My first script (simple auto talker)
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“omg omg omg, post:6, topic:120943”]Sendkeys types too fast. Just use SRL.

{.Include srl\srl.scar} var loops: integer; begin loops:= 0; setupsrl; repeat; loops:= loops+1; wait(1000+random(100)); typesend('hi guys'); //choose text wait(2000+random(100)); until(loops = (number of times you want it to say)); end.
There you go, tell me if it doesn’t work.[/quote]

Yes but the original function in the first script was SendKeys. Besides, i added the Sleep function too.

Read full topic

item.title: My first script (simple auto talker)
item.dc:creator: @omg_omg_omg omg omg omg
item.description:
@omg_omg_omg wrote:

Sendkeys types too fast. Just use SRL.

{.Include srl\srl.scar} var loops: integer; begin loops:= 0; setupsrl; repeat; loops:= loops+1; wait(1000+random(100)); typesend('hi guys'); //choose text wait(2000+random(100)); until(loops = (number of times you want it to say)); end.
There you go, tell me if it doesn’t work.

item.title: My first script (simple auto talker)
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:2, topic:120943”]Do you know how to make constants?

Program AutoTalk;

Const
Talk = 'Write stuff here';  //Enter text between the ' '

begin
  repeat
    wait(1000);
    SendKeys(Talk+chr(13));  
    wait(2000);
  until(false);
end.

They’ll help you alot, especially if this line occurs on line 400. This way, you wont have to scroll down to line 400 just to change the text.[/quote]
How about this one:

[code]
{
SimpleTalker Program.

  1. Change the sentences inside the ’ ’ on lines
  2. Start the script
  3. Press F1 for it to type Sentence 1.
    Press F2 for it to type Sentence 2.
    Press F3 for it to type Sentence 3.

Made by IP-Drowner in addition to ‘thenewguy’ and ‘exps35’ script(s).
}

Program SimpleTalker;

const
Chat1 = ‘First sentence here.’; //Replace the sentence with your own.
Chat2 = ‘Second sentence here.’; //Replace the sentence with your own.
Chat3 = ‘Third sentence here.’; //Replace the sentence with your own.

procedure Const2Text;
begin
if(IsFKeyDown(2)) then
SendKeys(Chat1 + Chr(13));
Sleep(71)
if(IsFKeyDown(3)) then
SendKeys(Chat2 + Chr(13));
Sleep(69)
if(IsFKeyDown(4)) then
SendKeys(Chat3 + Chr(13));
Sleep(62)
end;

begin
repeat
Const2Text;
Until(IsFKeyDown(9))
end.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: My first script (simple auto talker)
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Do you know how to make constants?

Program AutoTalk;

Const
Talk = 'Write stuff here';  //Enter text between the ' '

begin
  repeat
    wait(1000);
    SendKeys(Talk+chr(13));  
    wait(2000);
  until(false);
end.

They’ll help you alot, especially if this line occurs on line 400. This way, you wont have to scroll down to line 400 just to change the text.

Read full topic

item.title: My first script (simple auto talker)
item.dc:creator: @thenewguy thenewguy
item.description:
@thenewguy wrote:

program AutoTalker; //Simple Auto Talker//
//My First Script (its a start lol)//

begin
repeat
wait(1000);
SendKeys(‘hi guys’+chr(13)); //Enter text between the ’ '//
wait(2000);
until(false);
end.
